params._accepted: Whether the token is accepted or not.

params._alpha: The `alpha` property value of the court.
params._feeForJuror: The `feeForJuror` property value of the court.
params._hiddenVotes: Whether the court has hidden votes or not.
params._jurorsForCourtJump: The `jurorsForCourtJump` property value of the court.
params._minStake: The `minStake` property value of the court.
params._supportedDisputeKits: Indexes of dispute kits that this court will support.
params._timesPerPeriod: The `timesPerPeriod` property value of the court.

params._arbitrable: The contract which created the dispute.
params._disputeID: The identifier of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.

params._disputeKitAddress: Address of the new dispute kit.
params._disputeKitID: ID of the new dispute kit.

params._enable: Whether the dispute kit has been enabled or disabled.

params._fromDisputeKitID: ID of the previous dispute kit.
params._toDisputeKitID: ID of the new dispute kit.

params._voteID: ID of the vote given to the drawn juror.

Initialized(uint64).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

params._degreeOfCoherencyFee: Juror's degree of coherency in this round applied to the dispute fee.
params._degreeOfCoherencyPnk: Juror's degree of coherency in this round applied to PNK.

params._rateDecimals: The new decimals of the fee token rate.
params._rateInEth: The new rate of the fee token in ETH.

params._disputeID: The identifier of the dispute in the Arbitrator contract.

params.newImplementation: Address of the new implementation the proxy is now forwarding calls to.

params._disputeKitAddress: The address of the dispute kit contract.

appeal(uint256,uint256,bytes).details: Access restricted to the Dispute Kit for this `disputeID`.

params._extraData: Extradata for the dispute. Can be required during court jump.
params._numberOfChoices: Number of choices for the dispute. Can be required during court jump.

returns.end: The end of the appeal period.
returns.start: The start of the appeal period.

arbitrationCost(bytes).details: It is recommended not to increase it often, as it can be highly time and gas consuming for the arbitrated contracts to cope with fee augmentation.

params._extraData: Additional info about the dispute. We use it to pass the ID of the dispute's court (first 32 bytes), the minimum number of jurors required (next 32 bytes) and the ID of the specific dispute kit (last 32 bytes).

arbitrationCost(bytes,address).details: It is recommended not to increase it often, as it can be highly time and gas consuming for the arbitrated contracts to cope with fee augmentation.

params._extraData: Additional info about the dispute. We use it to pass the ID of the dispute's court (first 32 bytes), the minimum number of jurors required (next 32 bytes) and the ID of the specific dispute kit (last 32 bytes).
params._feeToken: The ERC20 token used to pay fees.

params._accepted: Whether the token is supported or not as a method of fee payment.

params._alpha: The `alpha` property value of the court.
params._feeForJuror: The `feeForJuror` property value of the court.
params._hiddenVotes: The `hiddenVotes` property value of the court.
params._jurorsForCourtJump: The `jurorsForCourtJump` property value of the court.
params._minStake: The `minStake` property value of the court.
params._timesPerPeriod: The `timesPerPeriod` property value of the court.

params._rateDecimals: The new decimals of the fee token rate.
params._rateInEth: The new rate of the fee token in ETH.

params._instructor: The new value for the `instructor` storage variable.

params._jurorProsecutionModule: The new value for the `jurorProsecutionModule` storage variable.

params._owner: The new value for the `owner` storage variable.

params._pinakion: The new value for the `pinakion` storage variable.

params._sortitionModule: The new value for the `sortitionModule` storage variable.

params._toToken: The token to convert ETH into.

params._alpha: The `alpha` property value of the court.
params._feeForJuror: The `feeForJuror` property value of the court.
params._hiddenVotes: The `hiddenVotes` property value of the court.
params._jurorsForCourtJump: The `jurorsForCourtJump` property value of the court.
params._minStake: The `minStake` property value of the court.
params._parent: The `parent` property value of the court.
params._supportedDisputeKits: Indexes of dispute kits that this court will support.
params._timesPerPeriod: The `timesPerPeriod` property value of the court.

createDispute(uint256,bytes).details: Must be called by the arbitrable contract and pay at least `arbitrationCost(_extraData)` in ETH.

params._extraData: Additional info about the dispute. We use it to pass the ID of the dispute's court (first 32 bytes), the minimum number of jurors required (next 32 bytes) and the ID of the specific dispute kit (last 32 bytes).
params._numberOfChoices: The number of choices the arbitrator can choose from in this dispute.

returns.disputeID: The identifier of the dispute created.

createDispute(uint256,bytes,address,uint.details: Must be called by the arbitrable contract and pay at least `arbitrationCost(_extraData, _feeToken)` in the supported ERC20 token.

params._extraData: Additional info about the dispute. We use it to pass the ID of the dispute's court (first 32 bytes), the minimum number of jurors required (next 32 bytes) and the ID of the specific dispute kit (last 32 bytes).
params._feeAmount: Amount of the ERC20 token used to pay fees.
params._feeToken: The ERC20 token used to pay fees.
params._numberOfChoices: The number of choices the arbitrator can choose from in this dispute.

returns.disputeID: The identifier of the dispute created.

returns.overridden: Whether the ruling was overridden by appeal funding or not.
returns.tied: Whether it's a tie or not.

params._juror: The address of the juror to draw.

params._disputeKitIDs: The IDs of dispute kits which support should be added/removed.
params._enable: Whether add or remove the dispute kits from the court.

params._iterations: The number of iterations to run.

params._amount: The value sent with the call.
params._data: The data sent with the call.

returns.courtJump: Whether the dispute jumps to a new court or not.
returns.disputeKitJump: Whether the dispute jumps to a new dispute kit or not.
returns.newRoundNbVotes: The number of votes in the new round.

params._round: The round to get the info for.

returns._0: pnkAtStakePerJuror The PNK at stake per juror.

getRoundInfo(uint256,uint256).details: This function must not be called from a non-view function because it returns a dynamic array which might be very large, theoretically exceeding the block gas limit.

params._round: The round to get the info for.

params._courtID: The ID of the court to get the times from.

returns.timesPerPeriod: The timesPerPeriod array for the given court.

params._courtParameters: Numeric parameters of General court (minStake, alpha, feeForJuror and jurorsForCourtJump respectively).
params._disputeKit: The address of the default dispute kit.
params._hiddenVotes: The `hiddenVotes` property value of the general court.
params._jurorProsecutionModule: The address of the juror prosecution module.
params._pinakion: The address of the token contract.
params._sortitionModuleAddress: The sortition module responsible for sortition of the jurors.
params._timesPerPeriod: The `timesPerPeriod` property value of the general court.

params._courtID: The ID of the court to check the support for.
params._disputeKitID: The ID of the dispute kit to check the support for.

returns._0: Whether the dispute kit is supported or not.

proxiableUUID().details: IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the if statement.

params._newStake: The new stake. Note that the existing delayed stake will be nullified as non-relevant.

params._account: The account whose stake is being set.

returns._0: True if the stake was set successfully.

params._account: The account of the juror whose PNK to transfer.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Reverts if the execution is not performed via delegatecall or the execution context is not of a proxy with an ERC1967-compliant implementation pointing to self.

params.data: Data used in a delegate call to `newImplementation` if non-empty. This will typically be an encoded function call, and allows initializing the storage of the proxy like a Solidity constructor.
params.newImplementation: Address of the new implementation contract.

UUPSUnauthorizedCallContext().notice: The call is from an unauthorized context.

UUPSUnsupportedProxiableUUID(bytes32).notice: The storage `slot` is unsupported as a UUID.

AcceptedFeeToken(address,bool).notice: To be emitted when an ERC20 token is added or removed as a method to pay fees.

AppealDecision(uint256,address).notice: Emitted when the dispute is successfully appealed.

CourtCreated(uint96,uint96,bool,uint256,.notice: Emitted when a new court is created.

CourtJump(uint256,uint256,uint96,uint96).notice: Emitted when a dispute jumps to a new court.

CourtModified(uint96,bool,uint256,uint25.notice: Emitted when court's parameters are changed.

DisputeCreation(uint256,address).notice: To be emitted when a dispute is created.

DisputeKitCreated(uint256,address).notice: Emitted when a dispute kit is created.

DisputeKitEnabled(uint96,uint256,bool).notice: Emitted when a dispute kit is enabled/disabled in a court.

DisputeKitJump(uint256,uint256,uint256,u.notice: Emitted when a dispute jumps to a new dispute kit.

Draw(address,uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Emitted when an address is successfully drawn.

JurorRewardPenalty(address,uint256,uint2.notice: Emitted when juror's balance shifts after penalties/rewards has been processed.

LeftoverRewardSent(uint256,uint256,uint2.notice: Emitted when leftover reward sent to owner.

NewCurrencyRate(address,uint64,uint8).notice: To be emitted when the fee for a particular ERC20 token is updated.

Ruling(address,uint256,uint256).notice: To be raised when a ruling is given.

Upgraded(address).notice: Emitted when the `implementation` has been successfully upgraded.

addNewDisputeKit(address).notice: Add a new supported dispute kit, without enabling it. Use `enableDisputeKits()` to enable the dispute kit for a specific court.

appeal(uint256,uint256,bytes).notice: Appeals the ruling of a specified dispute.

appealCost(uint256).notice: Gets the cost of appealing a specified dispute.

appealPeriod(uint256).notice: Gets the start and the end of a specified dispute's current appeal period.

arbitrationCost(bytes).notice: Compute the cost of arbitration denominated in the native currency, typically ETH.

arbitrationCost(bytes,address).notice: Compute the cost of arbitration denominated in `_feeToken`.

changeCourtParameters(uint96,bool,uint25.notice: Changes the parameters of the court.

changeCurrencyRates(address,uint64,uint8.notice: Changes the currency rate of a fee token.

changeSortitionModule(address).notice: Changes the `_sortitionModule` storage variable. Note that the new module should be initialized for all courts.

createCourt(uint96,bool,uint256,uint256,.notice: Creates a court under a specified parent court.

createDispute(uint256,bytes).notice: Create a dispute and pay for the fees in the native currency, typically ETH.

createDispute(uint256,bytes,address,uint.notice: Create a dispute and pay for the fees in a supported ERC20 token.

currentRuling(uint256).notice: Gets the current ruling of a specified dispute.

draw(uint256,address).notice: Draws one juror for the dispute until the number votes paid for is reached.

enableDisputeKits(uint96,uint256[],bool).notice: Adds/removes court's support for specified dispute kits.

execute(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Distribute the PNKs at stake and the dispute fees for the specific round of the dispute. Can be called in parts.

executeOwnerProposal(address,uint256,byt.notice: Allows the owner to call anything on behalf of the contract.

getCourtAndDisputeKitJumps(uint256).notice: Checks whether a dispute will jump to new court/DK and enforces a compatibility check.

getDisputeKitsLength().notice: Returns the length of disputeKits array.

getNumberOfRounds(uint256).notice: Gets the number of rounds for a specified dispute.

getNumberOfVotes(uint256).notice: Gets the number of votes permitted for the specified dispute in the latest round.

getPnkAtStakePerJuror(uint256,uint256).notice: Gets the PNK at stake per juror for a specified dispute and round.

getRoundInfo(uint256,uint256).notice: Gets the round info for a specified dispute and round.

getTimesPerPeriod(uint96).notice: Gets the timesPerPeriod array for a given court.

isSupported(uint96,uint256).notice: Checks if a given dispute kit is supported by a given court.

passPeriod(uint256).notice: Passes the period of a specified dispute.

proxiableUUID().notice: Implementation of the ERC1822 `proxiableUUID` function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade.

setStake(uint96,uint256).notice: Sets the caller's stake in a court.

setStakeBySortitionModule(address,uint96.notice: Sets the stake of a specified account in a court, typically to apply a delayed stake or unstake inactive jurors.

transferBySortitionModule(address,uint25.notice: Transfers PNK to the juror by SortitionModule.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).notice: Upgrade mechanism including access control and UUPS-compliance.

version().notice: Returns the version of the implementation.

userdoc.notice: Core arbitrator contract for educational purposes.
